title: Segunda Katigbak
description: Segunda Katigbak was her puppy love. Unfortunately, his first love was engaged to be married to a town mate.

title: Leonor Rivera
description: Leonor Rivera, his sweetheart for 11 years played the greatest influence in keeping him from falling in love with other women during his travel.

title: Consuelo Ortiga
description: Consuelo Ortiga y Rey, the prettier of Don Pablo Ortiga’s daughters, fell in love with him.

title: O Sei San
description: O Sei San, a Japanese samurai’s daughter taught Rizal the Japanese art of painting known as su-mie.

title: Gertrude Beckett
description: While Rizal was in London annotating the Sucesos de las Islas Filipinas, he boarded in the house of the Beckett family.

title: Nellie Boustead
description: Rizal having lost Leonor Rivera, entertained the thought of courting other ladies.

title: Suzanne Jacoby
description: Rizal moved to Brussels because of the high cost of living in Paris. In Brussels, he lived in the boarding house of the two Jacoby sisters.

title: Josephine Bracken
description: In the last days of February 1895, while still in Dapitan, Rizal met an 18-year old petite Irish girl, with bold blue eyes, brown hair and a happy disposition.

title: Huling Paalam
description: Also known as "Mi Ultimo Adios", the last poem of Rizal

title: To The Philippines
description: Rizal wrote the original sonnet in Spanish

title: Our Mother Tongue
description: A poem originally in Tagalog written by Rizal when he was only eight years old.

title: Memories of My Town
description: Memories of My Town

title: Imno sa Paggawa
description: Salin sa tulang “Himno al Trabajo” na sinulat ni Rizal sa kahilingan ng kaniyang mga kaibigang taga-Lipaa, Batangas upang awitin sa pag-diriwang dahil sa pagiging lungsod ng Lipa.

title: Kundiman
description: Salin sa tulang “Himno al Trabajo” na sinulat ni Rizal sa kahilingan ng kaniyang mga kaibigang taga-Lipaa, Batangas upang awitin sa pag-diriwang dahil sa pagiging lungsod ng Lipa.

title: A poem that has no title
description: A poem that has no title

title: Song of Maria Clara
description: Ang tulang ito'y matatagpuan sa Noli Me Tangere ang inawit ni Maria Clara, kaya gayon ang pamagat.

title: To The Philippines' Youth
description: Salin ito ng tulang “A La Juventud Filipina” na sinulat ni Rizal sa Unibersidad ng Santo Tomas noong siya’y labingwalong taong gulang.

title: To Josephine
description: Rizal dedicated this poem to Josephine Bracken.

title: Education Gives Luster to the Motherland
description: Education Gives Luster to the Motherland

title: To the Virgin Mary
description: To the Virgin Mary

title: Sa Aking mga Kabata
description: Unang tula na isinulat ni Rizal noong siya'y walong taong gulang

title: A la Senorita C.O. y R.
description: Tula na isinulat ni Rizal para kay Consulo Ortiga
